page.title: 14Buxton:Employment.
page.content: Buxton employment figures in 1985 are more favourable than other areas in the {High Peak}but nevertheless numbers of people have to travel out of Buxton to Macclesfield,Stockport and Manchester for work. Nearer Buxton itself the limestone quarries at Hindlow, Topley Pike and Tunstead provide work. Buxton itself provides employment for people in the service industries, ranging from the High Peak Borough Council itself to shops, schools, offices, and transport. British Rail have a station and an engine depot. North Western Buses have a bus station and garage. We discovered further evidence of Buxton's importance as a tourist centre when we listed eighteen hotels, all of which provide employment. There are also twelve restaurants, cafes and eating places.
